A.9.1.2.title: Access to networks and network services
A.9.1.2.description: Users should only be provided with access to the network and network services that they have been specifically authorized to use.
A.9.1.2.objective: A.9.1 Business requirements of access control

A.9.2.1.title: User registration and de-registration
A.9.2.1.description: A formal user registration and de-registration process should be implemented to enable assignment of access rights.

A.9.2.2.title: User access provisioning
A.9.2.2.description: A formal user access provisioning process should be implemented to assign or revoke access rights for all user types to all systems and services.

A.9.2.3.title: Management of privileged access rights
A.9.2.3.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights should be restricted and controlled.

A.9.4.2.title: Secure log-on procedures
A.9.4.2.description: Where required by the access control policy, access to systems and applications should be controlled by a secure log-on procedure.
A.9.4.2.objective: A.9.4 System and application access control

A.9.4.3.title: Password management system
A.9.4.3.description: Password management systems should be interactive and should ensure quality passwords.
A.9.4.3.objective: A.9.4 System and application access control

A.10.1.1.title: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls
A.10.1.1.description: A policy on the use of cryptographic controls for protection of information should be developed and implemented.
A.10.1.1.remediation: Enable encryption at rest and in transit

A.10.1.2.title: Key management
A.10.1.2.description: A policy on the use, protection and lifetime of cryptographic keys should be developed and implemented through their whole lifecycle.

A.12.3.1.title: Information backup
A.12.3.1.description: Backup copies of information, software and system images should be taken and tested regularly.

A.12.4.1.title: Event logging
A.12.4.1.description: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions, faults and information security events should be produced, kept and regularly reviewed.

A.12.6.1.title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
A.12.6.1.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems being used should be obtained in a timely fashion.

A.13.1.1.title: Network controls
A.13.1.1.description: Networks should be managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.

A.13.1.3.title: Segregation in networks
A.13.1.3.description: Groups of information services, users and information systems should be segregated on networks.
